Minotaurs are furry ungulates found in the Vault of War within the Stronghold of Security. They are also found in Turael's/Spria's basement where they are level 44, however, the player must be on their slayer challenge in order to access it. They drop the right skull half, the first piece of the Skull sceptre. Many players train Ranged on these monsters, as they often drop iron arrows.

Minotaurs are commonly used for training for low and mid level players, but some times even high level ones, because they have low strength and defence. However, their accuracy can be a problem for long training sessions, especially if the player has a low defence level or uses insufficient protection. They do hit high for their level so be sure to bring food.

Setting up a dwarf cannon at Minotaurs can be a decent way to obtain an easy Clue Scroll.

These items are dropped alongside main drops.

    • Right skull half drop

Update history[edit | edit source]

This information has been compiled as part of the update history project. Some updates may not be included – see here for how to help out!
  • patch 12 February 2024 (Update):
    • Rebalanced several low level monsters that were harder to kill than intended
  • ninja 17 August 2015 (Update):
    • Various gauntlets are now dropped from additional NPCs:
      • Iron - minotaurs
  • patch 12 May 2014 (Update):
    • Minotaurs have been graphically updated across the game.
  • update 4 July 2006 (Update):
    • Added to game.

Trivia[edit | edit source]

  • The minotaur's maximum hit exceeds that of the next monster that drops a piece of the skull sceptre, the flesh crawler.
  • Minotaurs received a graphical update during the 12 May 2014 update that brought graphical updates to other monsters.
  • Minotaurs often retreat at low health.
